response: "{ \"title\": \"Hard: Triangle Sums\", \"description\": \"Given an array of integers where each element represents the side length of a triangle, return whether all triangles formed by any three elements are valid or not. A triangle is considered valid if the sum of the lengths of any two sides is greater than the third side.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef is_triangle_valid(triangle_sides: list[int]) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `triangle_sides` (list[int]): A list of integers representing the side lengths of a triangle.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if all triangles formed by any three elements in the input array are valid, `False` otherwise.\\n\", \"code\": \"def is_triangle_valid(triangle_sides: list[int]) -> bool:\\n    for i in range(len(triangle_sides) - 2):\\n        for j in range(i + 1, len(triangle_sides) - 1):\\n            for k in range(j + 1, len(triangle_sides)):\\n                sides = sorted([triangle_sides[i], triangle_sides[j], triangle_sides[k]])\\n                if sides[0] + sides[1] <= sides[2]:\\n                    return False\\n    return True\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_triangle_valid([10, 5, 6]) == True\", \"assert is_triangle_valid([3, 4, 7]) == False\", \"assert is_triangle_valid([1, 2, 3, 4]) == False\"] }"
